meta.Title: MORE FIGURES OF SPEECH [New York Times, Sunday, May 29, 1960]
meta.Author: Herbert Ettenson

across.question: "An apothecary should never be out of spirits."
"And faith unfaithful kept him falsely true."
"To take arms against a sea of troubles."

down.question: "For God, for country, and for Yale."
"I am no orator as Brutus is, but . . . a plain blunt man."
Substitution, as of tenses in the Scripture.
"Illiterate him . . . from your memory," et al.
"She had a heart—how shall I say?—too soon made glad . . . "
"To the tintinabulation that so musically wells . . . "
"To err is human, to forgive divine."
